TopicTitle: GODZILLA Thread - ''He's not a Monster, He's a God''

Articles.Content:
Summary

An epic rebirth to Toho's iconic Godzilla, this spectacular adventure pits the world's most famous monster against malevolent creatures who, bolstered by humanity's scientific arrogance, threaten our very existence.

Worldwide Release Dates:

Check the following link for the theatrical debut for your respective country: http://www.godzillamovie.com/releasedates/

I love the MUTO creature...

And what is it with Kaiju and the Golden Gate Bridge? THEY ALWAYS GO FOR THE BRIDGE!!!!
thats the thing about these kind of movies, you have to destroy a landmark or two.

I love the MUTO creature...

And what is it with Kaiju and the Golden Gate Bridge? THEY ALWAYS GO FOR THE BRIDGE!!!!

Yeah but it seems here that Godzilla gets slammed into the bridge by the rockets. The cool thing I do like is how the bridge doesn't even bother him or hurt him. He simply plows trough it where as in Pacific Rim it took a Kaiju some sharp claws and some pushing to destroy it.

Yeah but it seems here that Godzilla gets slammed into the bridge by the rockets. The cool thing I do like is how the bridge doesn't even bother him or hurt him. He simply plows trough it where as in Pacific Rim it took a Kaiju some sharp claws and some pushing to destroy it.

Didn't they do that with the Brooklyn Bridge in the cheap Ferris Bueller knock-off film? I wonder if they were subtly picking fun at that? "Hey' let's trap him up in the bridge and pummel him with missi-- oh, err... nevermind."

And.... OMG, RODAN is in this?!
Nope, that's MUTO. Exactly what MUTO is remains a mystery; however, he seems to absorb electrical energy.
Godzilla is the only creature that they licensed from Toho. No Rodan or Mothra etc
I just found out that MUTO stands latin for Change. Maybe some speculation is correct in that one of the MUTO changes and grows over time.
